instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
Board is not powering ON, PPBUS, PP5V_S5, and PP3V3_S5 are present. PP5V_S4 and P5VS4_EN are not present.

I have bypassed the SMC. I could see the fan running at high speed for few seconds and repeating. And the PP5V_S4  is also present. Can I know how can I proceed?

Br
Manu

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
Sorry I was using a MagSafe charger with a variable power supply for measuring the current. That's the reason I didn't get  P5VS4_EN .

Now I have connected an 85W charger directly, I can see the Fan is running for 5second, then stops and repeat the same. 
PPBUS - 12.58V
PP5V_S5 - 5.078V
PP5V_S4 - 5.034V


PLT_RESET_L - 3.349V-fluctuating along with Fan
3V3_S5_REG is stable -3.349V

Br
Manu

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
Any history fault?

Try to start with both charger and battery connected.
Does it charge the battery at least?

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: When I connect battery and charger I can see a current consumption of 2.5 amp min , Seems like the battery is charging. Because I can see the green and yellow light on the charger.

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
That is not a confirmation.
Check PPBUS_G3H voltage; should increase slowly, when charges battery.

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: Ohh my lord, I don't know what happened suddenly. I don't have a PP_bus anymore. Mag safe light is not glowing. U7100 vdd (PP5V1_CHGR_VDD) is present. I/P also present (PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR - 19.7V). SMC_RESET_L is 0V. No idea why. Have I spoiled it :cry:??

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
Post basic U7100 voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Use the pins of surrounding components as test points.

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
Hi Kevin, 
Here is the voltages measured on U7100 
pin 1 = 0V
Pin 2 = -20V
Pin3 = 4.768V
Pin9 = 0.059V
Pin12 = 0.096V
Pin13 = 0.080V
Pin14 = I couldnt measure
Pin15 = 0.0V
Pin17 = 0.255V
Pin19 = 5.475V
Pin20 = 5.479V
Pin27 = 19.76V
Br
Manu

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
"Pin12 = 0.096V"
Missing 3V42_G3H, board can't start.
Check for short at L7095 and post Q7010 and U7090 voltages.

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
Q7010 - 
pin4 - 6.7V
pin 1 - 20.21V
pin 5 - 20.21V


U7090-
pin 6 - 18.47V
pin 3 - 1.063V
pin 1 - 0.589V
pin 4 - .256V
pin 2 - 0.096V

Shall I replace LT3470AED ?

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
Do you get voltage at pin 8 too?
Post diode mode to ground at L7095.

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
Additional info:-
I have removed U7090 and L7095. Still, there is a short (0.2Ohm) between the 2nd pin of the L7095 and GND.
In the diode - the voltage is 0V (After removing the inductor and U7090).

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: I couldn't measure voltage at pin 8, Because  I have already removed the IC.Its clear that  U7090 is not creating the short ,Still not sure what is causing the short at  3V42_G3H

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
Use voltage injection method.
Start with 1V, no more than 4V.

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: What is the max current setting? I have a variable power supply with maximum 5Amp . I hope it can do the job. Additional to that I don't have a thermal camera. ☹️

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
"What is the max current setting?"
The MAX of your PSU; we discussed so many times on the forum about that.
The current is auto adjusted, depending by injected voltage and short resistance.
Please, try to understand Ohm law!

BTW, 5A doesn't help for short check many times.
If the short sinks more than 5A (sometime occurs even with 1V), PSU will get blocked.

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
It is SMC , 
SMC is getting heating up in 1.4Amp itself.
I can remove an SMC from a faulty board and replace. Is there any tutorial for reballing ? Is it mandatory to have a stencil?

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message:
You can place the balls by hand; tedious job however.
The stencil with solder paste is the fastest way.

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: I have never tried this , should I buy balls separate? Do we have any guidance which I can follow?

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: Several videos available on YouTube...

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: Is there an option I can buy a new programmed SMC? So that I can directly solder that instead of reballing

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: You need SMC from same model board, not new.

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: One more question, Is smc program of A1398 820-3332A is compatible with 820-3787A?

threads.title: A1398 - 820-3787A - no P5VS4_EN  23mA current consumption
threads.message: Not compatible...
